title: Royal Family staff 'blocked The Crown cast from attending event'
text:
Prince Charles’ team reportedly vetoed The Crown cast from a guest list (Picture: Metro.co.uk)

The Royal Family staff banned the cast of The Crown from certain events with them after becoming worried that Prince Charles’ affair portrayal will affect his popularity with the public, it’s claimed.

According to new reports, the palace vetoed invites to stars including Olivia Colman and Josh O’Connor to the launch of Sir David Attenborough’s Our Planet in April, ahead of Princes Charles, William and Harry’s arrival.

‘The next few seasons are going to be increasingly focused on the Prince of Wales’ behaviour, especially around his marriage to Diana and affair with Camilla,’ a source told The Sun.

‘The timing couldn’t be any more disastrous in terms of Charles’s bid for popularity.

‘So his staff made it clear he wouldn’t attend the event if Netflix had any The Crown actors there.’

‘The decision was not one at the request of, instruction of, or direction of any of the members of the Royal Family,’ a staff member of Buckingham Palace added to the paper.

Metro.co.uk has approached both parties for comment.

It was added that it was wrong to suggest Charles had personal involvement in their blocking from the event.

‘There is no blanket ban or boycott of The Crown. Olivia Colman will be at Buckingham Palace for her CBE at some point.’

In the upcoming episodes, Josh O’Connor will take over the role of Prince Charles as the show time jumps to 1964 and runs through to 1977.

William, Charles and Harry joined Sir David at the launch of Our Planet in April (Picture: John Phillips/Getty Images)

During this period, Charles met and fell in love with ‘chain smoking serial snogger’ Camilla (Emerald Fennell), but their romance came to an abrupt end when Charles went off on naval duties

Camilla then married Andrew Parker Bowles in 1973, with the marriage coming to an end in 1995.

Meanwhile, Charles went on to marry Lady Diana Spencer in 1981, which ended in divorce in 1996.

Camilla and Charles finally married in 2005.

Diana (played by Emma Corrin) will not appear until season four as a result, but the trailer sees Charles torn between his commitment to the monarchy and his love of Camilla.

The Crown season 3 launches 11 November on Netflix.
